list_definition.definition: care taken to avoid accidents, disease etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They took every precaution to ensure that their journey would be safe and enjoyable.

list_ex_of_english: As a precaution against (rare) flooding, the main ground level should be kept at its present safe and dry elevation.
He was advised to take precautions to prevent uninvited visitors or tourists visiting the graves.
By comparison, the earlier building orders, regulations and codes did not go beyond some basic controls and general precautions against the danger of fire.
Depending on security precautions, those risks might be greater than the risks of disclosure or discovery in other media.
Even with these precautions, some level of risk of illness associated with the consumption of cantaloupes remains.
Compost now sold from the farm carries a quite clear health warning and the basic hygiene precautions which should be observed during its handling.
Without further precautions the film would quickly have returned and covered the surface of the tank (at a rate of several cmjs).
All possible precautions to prevent the isolation medium from drying should be taken.
